All Phase 1 features defined.
1. Introduction &amp; Purpose
1.1 Purpose of This Document
This Product Requirements Document (PRD) defines, in exhaustive detail, every feature, user story, acceptance criterion, API endpoint, data model, error state, and non-functional requirement for the Phase 1 MVP of CreativeAI â€” a bootstrapped, consumer-first AI creative studio SaaS.
The goal is to provide developers, designers, and QA with a single authoritative reference that eliminates ambiguity and leaves no room for interpretation errors during implementation. Every decision documented here has been made deliberately; deviations require explicit written approval from the Product Owner.

1.2 Product Overview
CreativeAI is an all-in-one AI creative studio designed exclusively for individual creators â€” hobbyists, students, side-hustlers, and casual makers. The core promise: generate stunning AI images, make short video clips, edit photos, and access curated templates â€” all in a single browser tab, with zero learning curve, at $5â€“$19/month.

<w:tblPr><w:tblW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tblBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideH w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideV w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/></w:tblBorders></w:tblPr><w:tblGrid><w:gridCol w:w="9360"/></w:tblGrid><w:tr><w:tc><w:tcPr><w:tcW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tcBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/></w:tcBorders><w:shd w:fill="EBF2FF" w:val="clear"/><w:tcMar><w:top w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:left w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/><w:bottom w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:right w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/></w:tcMar></w:tcPr><w:p><w:pPr><w:spacing w:before="0" w:after="60"/></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:cs="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial"/><w:b/><w:bCs/><w:color w:val="1A56DB"/><w:sz w:val="22"/><w:szCs w:val="22"/></w:rPr><w:t xml:space="preserve">North Star Metric
Time-to-first-creation: A brand-new user who signs up for the free tier must be able to generate their first AI image within 90 seconds of account creation, with no tutorial required.

1.3 Phase 1 Feature Scope
The following six feature areas comprise the full Phase 1 MVP. Each is covered in its own dedicated section below:
Feature 1: AI Image Generation (Section 3)
Feature 2: Image Editing (Section 4)
Feature 3: Short AI Video Clips (Section 5)
Feature 4: Template Library (Section 6)
Feature 5: Personal Gallery (Section 7)
Feature 6: Credit System (Section 8)

In addition, Sections 2 and 9â€“13 cover cross-cutting concerns: Authentication, User Accounts, Design System, Technical Architecture, API Specifications, Non-Functional Requirements, and Testing Strategy.

1.4 Out of Scope (Phase 1)
<w:tblPr><w:tblW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tblBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideH w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideV w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/></w:tblBorders></w:tblPr><w:tblGrid><w:gridCol w:w="9360"/></w:tblGrid><w:tr><w:tc><w:tcPr><w:tcW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tcBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="FDE68A" w:sz="1"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="FDE68A" w:sz="1"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="FDE68A" w:sz="1"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="FDE68A" w:sz="1"/></w:tcBorders><w:shd w:fill="FFFBEB" w:val="clear"/><w:tcMar><w:top w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:left w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/><w:bottom w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:right w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/></w:tcMar></w:tcPr><w:p><w:pPr><w:spacing w:before="0" w:after="60"/></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:cs="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial"/><w:b/><w:bCs/><w:color w:val="D97706"/><w:sz w:val="22"/><w:szCs w:val="22"/></w:rPr><w:t xml:space="preserve">Explicit Phase 1 Exclusions
The following features are documented in the Business Plan as Phase 2 and must NOT be built in Phase 1: Character Consistency Engine, Brand Kit, AI Voiceover Generator, Personal Style Training (LoRA), Mobile App (iOS/Android), Team/collaboration features, Social sharing feed, API access for developers, White-label offering.

1.5 Definitions &amp; Abbreviations

2. User Accounts &amp; Authentication
2.1 Authentication Methods
Authentication is handled by Supabase Auth. The following sign-in methods must be supported at launch:
Email + Password: 
Standard email/password registration with email verification link sent on sign-up
Google OAuth 2.0: 
One-click sign-in via Google account; no password required
Magic Link: 
User enters email; receives a one-time sign-in link valid for 10 minutes

2.2 Registration Flow
The registration flow must be designed to minimize friction. The sequence is:
User clicks &apos;Get Started Free&apos; on the landing page or &apos;Sign Up&apos; in the app header
Modal or dedicated page presents three auth options: Google (primary CTA), Email/Password, Magic Link
On Google OAuth: redirect to Google consent screen â†’ redirect back â†’ account created â†’ onboarding flow starts
On Email/Password: user enters email + password (min 8 chars) â†’ verification email sent â†’ user lands on &apos;Check your email&apos; screen â†’ clicks link â†’ account activated â†’ onboarding flow starts
On Magic Link: user enters email â†’ magic link sent â†’ &apos;Check your email&apos; screen â†’ user clicks link â†’ account created/signed-in â†’ onboarding flow starts

<w:tblPr><w:tblW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tblBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideH w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideV w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/></w:tblBorders></w:tblPr><w:tblGrid><w:gridCol w:w="9360"/></w:tblGrid><w:tr><w:tc><w:tcPr><w:tcW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tcBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="FECACA" w:sz="1"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="FECACA" w:sz="1"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="FECACA" w:sz="1"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="FECACA" w:sz="1"/></w:tcBorders><w:shd w:fill="FEF2F2" w:val="clear"/><w:tcMar><w:top w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:left w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/><w:bottom w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:right w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/></w:tcMar></w:tcPr><w:p><w:pPr><w:spacing w:before="0" w:after="60"/></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:cs="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial"/><w:b/><w:bCs/><w:color w:val="DC2626"/><w:sz w:val="22"/><w:szCs w:val="22"/></w:rPr><w:t xml:space="preserve">Critical Rule
No credit card is required at registration. The Free tier must be instantly accessible with zero payment friction. Asking for payment before the user has experienced value is explicitly prohibited.

2.3 Onboarding Flow (First-Time Users Only)
Every new user must experience a 3-step onboarding flow immediately after account creation. This flow cannot be skipped on first login but can be dismissed midway (user lands on dashboard).

2.5 Account Settings Page
Accessible via avatar menu â†’ &apos;Account Settings&apos;. Must include:
Display name (editable text field, max 40 chars)
Email address (read-only if Google OAuth; editable otherwise â€” requires re-verification)
Password change (only for email/password accounts; requires current password)
Subscription plan display (current plan name, renewal date, &apos;Manage / Upgrade&apos; CTA linking to billing portal)
Credit balance display (remaining credits + rollover balance)
Delete account (requires typing &apos;DELETE&apos; to confirm; soft-deletes; sends confirmation email; all data deleted after 30-day grace period)
3. Feature 1 â€” AI Image Generation
<w:tblPr><w:tblW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tblBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideH w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideV w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/></w:tblBorders></w:tblPr><w:tblGrid><w:gridCol w:w="9360"/></w:tblGrid><w:tr><w:tc><w:tcPr><w:tcW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tcBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/></w:tcBorders><w:shd w:fill="EBF2FF" w:val="clear"/><w:tcMar><w:top w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:left w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/><w:bottom w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:right w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/></w:tcMar></w:tcPr><w:p><w:pPr><w:spacing w:before="0" w:after="60"/></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:cs="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial"/><w:b/><w:bCs/><w:color w:val="1A56DB"/><w:sz w:val="22"/><w:szCs w:val="22"/></w:rPr><w:t xml:space="preserve">Feature Summary
Users type a text prompt, choose a style preset and aspect ratio, and the system returns one AI-generated image using the selected model. Generation consumes credits. Free tier outputs carry a watermark.

3.1 UI Layout &amp; Flow
The Image Generation screen is the primary home screen of the application. Layout (desktop, left-to-right):
Left panel (320px, fixed): Prompt input, Style preset selector, Aspect ratio selector, Advanced options accordion (collapsed by default), Generate button, Credit cost indicator
Right panel (fluid): Output display area â€” shows the generated image; before first generation shows an animated placeholder with example prompts

Mobile layout: vertically stacked â€” prompt and controls above, output below. Generate button is sticky at the bottom of the viewport.

3.2 Prompt Input
Field type: 
Multi-line textarea, min 2 rows, auto-expands up to 6 rows
Character limit: 
Maximum 500 characters; live character counter shown (e.g., &apos;142 / 500&apos;)
Placeholder text: 
Rotating examples every 4 seconds: &apos;A golden retriever in a coffee shop, watercolor style&apos; / &apos;Cyberpunk city at night, neon reflections&apos; / &apos;Portrait of a woman in Renaissance style&apos;
Prompt enhancement toggle: 
A subtle toggle labeled &apos;âœ¨ Enhance prompt&apos; â€” when ON, the system appends quality-boosting suffix tokens before sending to the model (e.g., &apos;, highly detailed, sharp focus, 8k&apos;). Default: ON for new users
Negative prompt: 
Collapsed inside &apos;Advanced Options&apos; accordion. Textarea, max 300 chars. Placeholder: &apos;Things you do NOT want in the image (e.g., blurry, watermark, extra fingers)&apos;

3.3 Style Presets
Style presets are visual shortcuts that configure model parameters without exposing technical complexity. Must be displayed as selectable cards with a thumbnail preview image and a label.

3.5 Advanced Options (Collapsed Accordion)
Seed: 
Integer field, default blank (random). When specified, produces deterministic output from same prompt. Label: &apos;Seed (leave blank for random)&apos;
Guidance Scale (CFG): 
Slider from 1â€“15, default 7. Tooltip: &apos;Higher = image follows prompt more strictly. Lower = more creative/random&apos;
Number of images: 
Segment control: 1 (default) / 2 / 4. Note: 2 images costs 2 credits, 4 costs 4 credits. Warning shown dynamically
Negative prompt: 
Textarea as described in 3.2 above

3.6 Generation States &amp; UX

3.7 Output Actions
After a successful generation, the user sees the following actions beneath the output image:
Download (PNG): 
Downloads the full-resolution PNG. Free tier downloads include watermark. Paid tiers download clean image
Save to Gallery: 
Saves the generation (prompt, style, seed, output URL) to the user&apos;s personal gallery. Auto-saves for paid users; manual for free
Generate Variations: 
Re-runs the same prompt with seed Â±50 to produce 2 similar-but-different outputs. Costs 2 additional credits
Edit Image: 
One-click transition to the Image Editing screen (Feature 2) with this image pre-loaded
Copy Prompt: 
Copies the exact prompt used to clipboard. Useful for iteration

3.8 Watermark Specification
Free tier watermarks must follow these exact specifications to ensure they cannot be easily cropped:
Logo: &apos;CreativeAI&apos; wordmark in white with 60% opacity
Position: Bottom-right corner AND bottom-left corner (dual placement prevents cropping)
Size: 12% of image short-edge width
Applied server-side using Sharp.js BEFORE the download URL is generated â€” never applied client-side
Watermark is NOT applied to in-app preview â€” only to the downloaded file

Watermark is applied server-side before download URL is returned
In-app preview does NOT show the watermark

<w:tcPr><w:tcW w:type="dxa" w:w="4660"/><w:tcBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="E5E7EB" w:sz="1"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="E5E7EB" w:sz="1"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="E5E7EB" w:sz="1"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="E5E7EB" w:sz="1"/></w:tcBorders><w:shd w:fill="FFFFFF" w:val="clear"/><w:tcMar><w:top w:type="dxa" w:w="80"/><w:left w:type="dxa" w:w="100"/><w:bottom w:type="dxa" w:w="80"/><w:right w:type="dxa" w:w="100"/></w:tcMar></w:tcPr><w:p><w:pPr><w:pStyle w:val="ListParagraph"/><w:numPr><w:ilvl w:val="0"/><w:numId w:val="2"/></w:numPr><w:spacing w:before="20" w:after="20"/></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:cs="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial"/><w:color w:val="111827"/><w:sz w:val="18"/><w:szCs w:val="18"/></w:rPr><w:t xml:space="preserve">&apos;Enhance prompt&apos; toggle is ON by default for new users

4. Feature 2 â€” Image Editing
<w:tblPr><w:tblW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tblBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideH w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideV w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/></w:tblBorders></w:tblPr><w:tblGrid><w:gridCol w:w="9360"/></w:tblGrid><w:tr><w:tc><w:tcPr><w:tcW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tcBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/></w:tcBorders><w:shd w:fill="EBF2FF" w:val="clear"/><w:tcMar><w:top w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:left w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/><w:bottom w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:right w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/></w:tcMar></w:tcPr><w:p><w:pPr><w:spacing w:before="0" w:after="60"/></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:cs="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial"/><w:b/><w:bCs/><w:color w:val="1A56DB"/><w:sz w:val="22"/><w:szCs w:val="22"/></w:rPr><w:t xml:space="preserve">Feature Summary
Users can edit images â€” either their own AI generations or uploaded photos â€” using four one-click editing tools: Background Removal, Basic Inpainting, AI Upscaling, and One-Click Enhancements. Each tool consumes credits.

4.1 Accessing Image Editing
The Image Editing screen can be accessed in three ways:
Click &apos;Edit Image&apos; after generating an image (pre-loaded)
Click &apos;Edit&apos; on any image in the Personal Gallery
Click &apos;Upload &amp; Edit&apos; from the main navigation â€” user uploads a JPEG, PNG, or WebP file

4.2 Upload Specifications
Accepted formats: 
JPEG, PNG, WebP
Maximum file size: 
20 MB
Maximum dimensions: 
8000 Ã— 8000 px (images larger than this are rejected with error message)
Minimum dimensions: 
64 Ã— 64 px
Upload method: 
Drag-and-drop zone or file picker button. Progress bar shown during upload. File stored temporarily in Supabase Storage under /temp/{userId}/{uuid}.{ext}
Temporary file lifecycle: 
Temp files auto-deleted after 24 hours if not saved to gallery

4.3 Editing Tool 1 â€” Background Removal
Description
Removes the background from any image, leaving the subject on a transparent background. Output is a PNG with an alpha channel. The user can optionally replace the transparent background with a solid color or a new AI-generated background.

Implementation
API provider: 
Clipdrop API (/remove-background endpoint) or Replicate BRIA RMBG-2.0 model as fallback
Input: 
Original image file
Output: 
PNG with transparency
Credit cost: 
2 credits per use
Processing time target: 
&lt; 8 seconds (P95)

UX Flow
User clicks &apos;Remove Background&apos; tool card
Processing spinner shown over image preview
Result displayed: subject on checkerboard (transparency indicator)
Secondary options appear: &apos;Keep transparent&apos;, &apos;Add solid color background&apos;, &apos;AI background&apos; (costs +1 credit)
User downloads or saves to gallery

4.4 Editing Tool 2 â€” Basic Inpainting
Description
Allows users to mask a region of an image by painting over it with a brush, then describe what should replace that region with a text prompt. The AI fills in only the masked area while keeping the rest of the image intact.

Canvas &amp; Brush Specifications
Mask brush sizes: 
Small (10px), Medium (30px), Large (60px) â€” selectable via toolbar
Brush color: 
Red (#FF0000) at 50% opacity for visibility
Undo: 
Ctrl+Z / Cmd+Z undoes the last brush stroke; up to 10 undo levels
Clear mask: 
&apos;Clear Mask&apos; button resets the entire mask
Zoom: 
Pinch-to-zoom on mobile; scroll-to-zoom on desktop; range 50%â€“300%

Inpainting Generation
Inpainting model: 
Replicate FLUX.1-fill or SDXL-Inpainting model
Prompt input: 
Separate text field appears once mask is drawn: &apos;What should go here?&apos; (max 300 chars)
Strength: 
Fixed at 0.85 for Phase 1 (not user-configurable)
Credit cost: 
3 credits per inpainting generation
Output: 
Full image with masked region replaced; same dimensions as input

4.5 Editing Tool 3 â€” AI Upscaling
Description
Increases image resolution by 2Ã— or 4Ã— while enhancing fine details, sharpness, and reducing artifacts. Useful for users who want to print or use their image at large sizes.

Specifications
Upscaling options: 
2Ã— (doubles width and height) and 4Ã— (quadruples width and height)
Model: 
Replicate Real-ESRGAN or Clarity Upscaler model
Maximum output size: 
8000 Ã— 8000 px â€” if 4Ã— would exceed this, show warning and cap at maximum
Credit cost: 
2Ã— upscale: 2 credits. 4Ã— upscale: 4 credits
Processing time target: 
2Ã— &lt; 10s, 4Ã— &lt; 20s (P95)
Output format: 
PNG

UX
Before/after slider is shown after upscaling is complete, allowing the user to drag a divider line to compare the original and upscaled versions side by side.

4.6 Editing Tool 4 â€” One-Click Enhancements
A set of single-click AI enhancement filters. Each applies a specific transformation to the image. Only one enhancement can be applied per session (to avoid stacking/quality degradation). Cost: 1 credit per enhancement.

5. Feature 3 â€” Short AI Video Clips

Users can animate any image (AI-generated or uploaded) into a 3â€“5 second video clip. The animation is driven by a motion prompt describing the movement. Output is an MP4 video optimized for social media. Free tier cannot access video; Spark and above can.

Free tier users who navigate to the Video tool see a locked state UI with: a blurred/dimmed example video preview, the message &apos;Video creation is available on Spark and above&apos;, and a prominent &apos;Upgrade to Spark â€” $5/mo&apos; CTA button.

5.2 Video Generation Flow
User navigates to &apos;Video&apos; section from main navigation
User selects source image: from gallery, from current generation, or by uploading new image
User types a motion prompt (max 150 chars) â€” describes the movement (see presets in 5.3)
User selects clip duration: 3 seconds or 5 seconds
User clicks &apos;Animate&apos; â€” credit cost shown: 5 credits for 3s, 8 credits for 5s
Processing screen shown (estimated 30â€“90 seconds)
Completed video plays automatically in-app in a looping video player
User can download as MP4 or save to gallery

5.3 Motion Prompt Input &amp; Presets
The motion prompt field accepts free-text input AND offers one-click preset buttons that populate the field:

5.4 Video Generation Model &amp; API
Primary model: 
Replicate Stability AI Stable Video Diffusion (SVD-XT) or Kling Video API â€” chosen based on cost-per-second and output quality at time of implementation
Fallback model: 
Fal.ai AnimateDiff-Lightning if primary is unavailable
Input requirements: 
Source image is resized/cropped to 1024Ã—576 (16:9) or 576Ã—1024 (9:16) before submission, preserving aspect ratio with letterboxing if needed
Output format: 
MP4, H.264 codec, AAC audio stream (silent), bitrate 4â€“8 Mbps
Polling: 
Video generation is asynchronous. Backend polls the generation API every 5 seconds and pushes status updates to the frontend via Supabase Realtime

5.5 Credit Cost Table â€” Video

6.3 Template Library UI
Layout: 
Grid layout, responsive â€” 4 columns on desktop, 2 on tablet, 1 on mobile
Card design: 
Thumbnail image fills the card; template title overlaid at bottom in semi-transparent bar; category badge top-left; lock icon top-right for paid-only templates on free tier
Top section: 
Horizontal scrollable &apos;Featured&apos; row (3â€“5 templates); search bar; category filter tabs below
Search: 
Full-text search across template title and category; results filter the grid in real-time (client-side, no API call)
Category tabs: 
All | Social Posts | Thumbnails | Wallpapers | Avatars | Artistic | Seasonal
Hover state: 
Card lifts (shadow increase); &apos;Use Template â†’&apos; overlay CTA appears

6.4 Using a Template
User clicks a template card (&apos;Use Template â†’&apos;)
System navigates to Image Generation screen
Prompt field is pre-populated with the template&apos;s prompt
Style preset is auto-selected to match the template
Aspect ratio is auto-selected to match the template
Generate button is prominent â€” user can tweak or generate immediately
User can modify any pre-filled values freely before generating

Generating from a template costs standard image generation credits (1 credit per image). No additional template fee.

6.5 Access Control
Free tier: 
Can access and use templates marked is_free = true. Locked templates show lock icon and upgrade prompt when clicked
Spark and above: 
Full access to all templates
Template addition: 
New templates are added by admin only via a seeded database migration or admin-only Supabase dashboard â€” no user-generated templates in Phase 1

6.6 User Stories â€” Template Library

Clicking a locked template shows upgrade prompt, not an error
Free templates have no lock icon and work immediately

7. Feature 5 â€” Personal Gallery
<w:tblPr><w:tblW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tblBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideH w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideV w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/></w:tblBorders></w:tblPr><w:tblGrid><w:gridCol w:w="9360"/></w:tblGrid><w:tr><w:tc><w:tcPr><w:tcW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tcBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/></w:tcBorders><w:shd w:fill="EBF2FF" w:val="clear"/><w:tcMar><w:top w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:left w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/><w:bottom w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:right w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/></w:tcMar></w:tcPr><w:p><w:pPr><w:spacing w:before="0" w:after="60"/></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:cs="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial"/><w:b/><w:bCs/><w:color w:val="1A56DB"/><w:sz w:val="22"/><w:szCs w:val="22"/></w:rPr><w:t xml:space="preserve">Feature Summary
The Personal Gallery is each user&apos;s private cloud storage of all their past creations. Every generation (image and video) is saved here. Users can browse, re-download, delete, organize into collections, and jump back into editing from the gallery.

7.1 Gallery Data Model

7.3 Gallery UI
Layout: 
Masonry grid (Pinterest-style) â€” items flow naturally based on aspect ratio; 4 columns desktop, 2 tablet, 1 mobile
Sort options: 
Newest first (default) | Oldest first | Favorites first
Filter options: 
All | Images | Videos | Favorites
Search: 
Client-side search by prompt text â€” filters visible items in real-time
Item card: 
Thumbnail fills card; on hover: title (prompt truncated to 40 chars), date, action icons (Download, Edit, Favorite, Delete)
Bulk select: 
Checkbox appears on long-press (mobile) or right-click (desktop); bulk download (as ZIP) and bulk delete actions

7.4 Gallery Item Detail View
Clicking a gallery item opens a modal detail view containing:
Full-resolution image preview (or video player for clips)
Full prompt text (scrollable if long)
Metadata: style preset, aspect ratio, seed, model, date created
Action bar: Download, Edit (opens in editing screen), Generate Variations (costs 2 credits), Delete, Copy Prompt
&apos;Recreate&apos; button â€” re-runs the exact same generation (same prompt, style, seed) â€” costs 1 credit

7.5 Collections
Users can organize gallery items into named collections (like folders):
Create collection: 
Via &apos;New Collection&apos; button in gallery sidebar; name max 40 chars
Add to collection: 
Drag-and-drop item onto collection name, or right-click â†’ &apos;Add to Collection&apos; â†’ pick from list
Collection limits: 
Free: 3 collections; Spark: 10; Glow: 25; Pro: unlimited
Default collection: 
All items not in a collection appear in &apos;All Creations&apos; (the default view)

7.6 User Stories â€” Personal Gallery

8. Feature 6 â€” Credit System
<w:tblPr><w:tblW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tblBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideH w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideV w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/></w:tblBorders></w:tblPr><w:tblGrid><w:gridCol w:w="9360"/></w:tblGrid><w:tr><w:tc><w:tcPr><w:tcW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tcBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="BFDBFE" w:sz="1"/></w:tcBorders><w:shd w:fill="EBF2FF" w:val="clear"/><w:tcMar><w:top w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:left w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/><w:bottom w:type="dxa" w:w="140"/><w:right w:type="dxa" w:w="200"/></w:tcMar></w:tcPr><w:p><w:pPr><w:spacing w:before="0" w:after="60"/></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:cs="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial"/><w:b/><w:bCs/><w:color w:val="1A56DB"/><w:sz w:val="22"/><w:szCs w:val="22"/></w:rPr><w:t xml:space="preserve">Feature Summary
Credits are the internal currency of CreativeAI. Every generation and editing action costs credits. The system is transparent â€” users always know their balance and cost before acting. Credits roll over (unused credits carry to next month). This is the primary differentiator vs. all 7 competitors.

8.1 Credit Allocation by Plan
<w:tblPr><w:tblW w:type="dxa" w:w="9360"/><w:tblBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideH w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/><w:insideV w:val="single" w:color="auto" w:sz="4"/></w:tblBorders></w:tblPr><w:tblGrid><w:gridCol w:w="1600"/><w:gridCol w:w="1960"/><w:gridCol w:w="2400"/><w:gridCol w:w="1800"/><w:gridCol w:w="1600"/></w:tblGrid><w:tr><w:tc><w:tcPr><w:tcW w:type="dxa" w:w="1600"/><w:tcBorders><w:top w:val="single" w:color="E5E7EB" w:sz="1"/><w:left w:val="single" w:color="E5E7EB" w:sz="1"/><w:bottom w:val="single" w:color="E5E7EB" w:sz="1"/><w:right w:val="single" w:color="E5E7EB" w:sz="1"/></w:tcBorders><w:shd w:fill="1A56DB" w:val="clear"/><w:tcMar><w:top w:type="dxa" w:w="100"/><w:left w:type="dxa" w:w="120"/><w:bottom w:type="dxa" w:w="100"/><w:right w:type="dxa" w:w="120"/></w:tcMar></w:tcPr><w:p><w:r><w:rPr><w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:cs="Arial" w:eastAsia="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial"/><w:b/><w:bCs/><w:color w:val="FFFFFF"/><w:sz w:val="19"/><w:szCs w:val="19"/></w:rPr><w:t xml:space="preserve">Plan

*Pro plan is metered â€” there is a soft limit of 2,000 images and 120 videos per month before rate limiting kicks in. In Phase 1, the soft limit is not enforced; all Pro generations succeed. Rate limiting to be implemented in Phase 2.

8.2 Credit Balance Display
The credit balance must be visible at all times in the application. Placement and behavior:
Location: 
Top navigation bar, right side, adjacent to the user avatar â€” always visible
Format: 
Icon (lightning bolt âš¡) + number: &apos;âš¡ 147 credits&apos;
Tooltip on hover: 
Shows breakdown: &apos;Monthly credits: 120  |  Rollover from last month: 27  |  Total: 147&apos;
Low credit warning: 
When balance falls below 20 credits, the display changes to amber color and a subtle pulse animation
Zero credit state: 
Display turns red; all Generate / Edit buttons show disabled state with tooltip &apos;No credits remaining â€” top up or upgrade&apos;
Real-time updates: 
Balance updates immediately (optimistic) when an action is triggered and confirmed when the API responds

8.3 Pre-Action Cost Display
Before any credit-consuming action is triggered, the cost must be shown to the user. Rules:
Cost is displayed adjacent to the primary action button at all times (not just on hover)
Format: &apos;âš¡ 1 credit&apos; or &apos;âš¡ 3 credits&apos; â€” always in this format, never &apos;costs 1 credit&apos;
When batch count changes (1/2/4 images), cost updates dynamically in real-time
When user has insufficient credits, the button is disabled and the cost label changes to red with &apos;Need more credits&apos;

8.4 Credit Transaction Ledger
Every credit transaction is logged in a &apos;credit_transactions&apos; table for auditability:

8.5 Credit Top-Up (Pay-As-You-Go)
Access: 
Via &apos;Get More Credits&apos; button in the credit display tooltip, or via Account Settings â†’ Credits tab
Top-up packages: 
$2 = 20 credits (free tier) / 30 credits (paid tiers); $5 = 60 credits (free) / 80 credits (paid); $10 = 140 credits (free) / 180 credits (paid)
Payment: 
Processed via Stripe one-time payment (not a subscription charge)
Delivery: 
Credits added to account within 5 seconds of successful Stripe webhook receipt
Expiry: 
Top-up credits never expire â€” they accumulate with rollover credits

8.6 Monthly Credit Reset / Rollover Logic
The following logic runs on each billing cycle event (triggered by Stripe subscription renewal webhook or, for free users, a daily cron job on the 1st of each month):
Calculate unused credits from the current cycle: unused = credits_remaining - rollover_balance_at_cycle_start
For FREE tier: set credits_remaining = 25 (hard reset, no rollover). Insert credit_transaction record type = &apos;monthly_grant&apos;
For PAID tiers: add this month&apos;s credit_monthly_allowance to the existing balance. Insert credit_transaction type = &apos;monthly_grant&apos; for the new grant AND type = &apos;rollover&apos; for the carried-over amount
Update user.billing_cycle_start to today
Send &apos;Your credits have been refreshed&apos; in-app notification

8.7 Refund Logic
Automatic refund triggers: 
AI API returns 5xx error; generation times out (&gt;60s for images, &gt;180s for videos); explicit model error (not content policy violation)
Refund amount: 
Exact number of credits deducted for the failed action
Refund timing: 
Within 3 seconds of error detection; optimistic UI update followed by server confirmation
Refund for content policy blocks: 
NOT refunded â€” 1 credit is consumed when a generation is blocked for NSFW or content policy violation. A clear message explains this to the user
Refund record: 
Every refund creates a credit_transactions record with type = &apos;refund&apos; and references the original transaction&apos;s reference_id

8.8 Credit System â€” User Stories

9. Design System &amp; UI Specifications
All UI implementation must follow this design system precisely. Deviations require design review. These specs directly counter the dark/cold aesthetic of all 7 competitors and establish our differentiated visual identity.

9.1 Color Palette

All fonts are loaded from Google Fonts. Add display=swap parameter. Preload the Inter and Nunito font families in the HTML &lt;head&gt;.

9.3 Spacing &amp; Sizing
Base spacing unit: 
4px â€” all spacing values are multiples of 4
Border radius: 
Small components (badges, inputs): 6px. Cards: 12px. Modals: 16px. Buttons: 8px. Pill badges: 9999px
Shadow system: 
shadow-sm: 0 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.05); shadow-md: 0 4px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.07); shadow-lg: 0 10px 15px rgba(0,0,0,0.10)
Container max-width: 
1280px centered with auto left/right margins
Left panel (generation controls): 
320px fixed width on desktop; full-width on mobile

9.4 Button Specifications

9.5 Navigation Structure
The main navigation is a fixed left sidebar on desktop (240px wide) and a bottom tab bar on mobile (5 tabs). Items:

10.2 Environment Variables Required
All of the following must be configured in both .env.local (development) and Vercel environment variables (production):

10.3 Database Schema â€” Tables Summary
All tables below must be created in Supabase (PostgreSQL). Row-Level Security (RLS) must be enabled on all tables. Users may only read/write their own rows.

Service role manages INSERT/UPDATE

10.4 Generation Job Flow (Async Architecture)
Image and video generation is handled asynchronously. The following sequence must be implemented exactly:
Frontend sends POST /api/generate with prompt, style, ratio, user JWT
Backend validates JWT â†’ checks credits â†’ deducts credits optimistically (UPDATE users SET credits_remaining = credits_remaining - cost) â†’ creates generation_jobs row with status = &apos;pending&apos; â†’ returns {job_id, estimated_wait_seconds} to frontend
Backend triggers Replicate/Fal.ai API call asynchronously (do not await in the HTTP request cycle)
Frontend subscribes to Supabase Realtime on the generation_jobs row for the returned job_id
Replicate/Fal.ai webhook OR backend polling updates generation_jobs.status to &apos;processing&apos; then &apos;complete&apos; or &apos;failed&apos;
On &apos;complete&apos;: backend uploads output file to Cloudflare R2 â†’ creates gallery_items row â†’ updates generation_jobs.status = &apos;complete&apos; + output_url
Supabase Realtime pushes status change to frontend â†’ frontend fetches and displays the output image
On &apos;failed&apos;: backend restores credits (UPDATE users SET credits_remaining = credits_remaining + cost) â†’ creates credit_transactions refund record â†’ updates generation_jobs.status = &apos;failed&apos; â†’ Realtime pushes error to frontend
11. API Endpoint Specifications
All endpoints are served from the Next.js API routes at /api/*. All endpoints except /api/webhooks/* require a valid Supabase JWT in the Authorization: Bearer {token} header. All responses are JSON.

11.1 Authentication Endpoints
Authentication is handled directly by Supabase Auth client-side. No custom auth API routes are needed for login/signup/logout. The frontend uses the @supabase/ssr package.

11.2 Image Generation Endpoints

12.2 Reliability &amp; Availability
Uptime target: 
99.5% monthly uptime â€” maximum 3.6 hours downtime per month
AI API fallback: 
If Replicate.com returns errors for &gt;3 consecutive requests, auto-switch to Fal.ai for the next 5 minutes
Database availability: 
Supabase provides 99.9% SLA â€” acceptable for Phase 1
Data backup: 
Supabase daily backups enabled. Cloudflare R2 has built-in redundancy
Zero-downtime deploys: 
Vercel handles this automatically via its deployment pipeline

12.3 Security
Authentication: 
All API routes validate Supabase JWT on every request. JWTs expire after 1 hour; auto-refreshed by Supabase client
Row-level security: 
Supabase RLS enabled on all tables â€” users cannot access other users&apos; data even with valid JWT
API keys: 
All third-party API keys stored as environment variables; never committed to version control; never returned to the client
Input validation: 
All API inputs validated using Zod schema validation before processing. Invalid inputs return 400 with specific error messages
Rate limiting: 
IP-based rate limiting: 60 requests per minute per IP on all /api/* routes using Vercel Edge Middleware
Content moderation: 
All prompts run through a moderation check (OpenAI Moderation API or equivalent) before submission to generation APIs. Flagged prompts are rejected with CONTENT_POLICY_VIOLATION error
HTTPS: 
Enforced on all routes by Vercel. HTTP requests redirected to HTTPS
CORS: 
API routes only accept requests from the production and staging frontend origins
Webhook validation: 
Stripe webhook signature verified using Stripe SDK on every incoming webhook

12.4 Scalability
Stateless API: 
All API routes are stateless serverless functions â€” scale horizontally automatically on Vercel
Database connections: 
Use Supabase connection pooling (PgBouncer) to prevent connection exhaustion
Generation queue: 
If daily generation volume exceeds 5,000, introduce a Redis-based queue (Upstash) â€” not needed at launch
Storage: 
Cloudflare R2 has no practical storage limit â€” scales without intervention

12.5 Accessibility
WCAG standard: 
All UI components must meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA
Keyboard navigation: 
All interactive elements reachable and operable via keyboard (Tab, Enter, Space, Arrow keys)
Screen reader: 
All images have descriptive alt text. ARIA labels on icon-only buttons. Live regions for generation status updates
Color contrast: 
All text meets minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio against its background
Focus indicators: 
Visible focus ring on all interactive elements (2px solid color-primary)
13. Testing Requirements
13.1 Testing Levels Required
All of the following testing types are mandatory before any feature is marked &apos;complete&apos; and merged to main:
Unit tests: 
All utility functions, credit calculation logic, prompt validation, and Zod schemas. Coverage target: 80%
Integration tests: 
All /api/* routes tested with mock AI API responses. Every endpoint&apos;s success path, auth failure path, and error path must be tested
End-to-end tests: 
Playwright E2E tests for the 5 critical user flows listed in 13.2. Run on every pull request via CI
Visual regression: 
Percy or Chromatic snapshots for all key screens. Any visual change must be explicitly approved

13.2 Critical E2E Test Scenarios (Must Pass Before Launch)

Download produces PNG with transparency. 2 credits deducted.

Image generates successfully.

13.3 Definition of Done
A feature is only considered done and ready for production deployment when ALL of the following are true:
All user stories for the feature have acceptance criteria verified by QA
All API endpoints for the feature have integration tests passing
E2E tests for the feature pass in CI on a staging environment
Visual regression snapshots are approved
The feature has been manually tested by the Product Owner on the staging environment
No P0 or P1 bugs are open for this feature
Error states and edge cases have been tested (empty states, network failures, invalid inputs)
Accessibility check passed (keyboard navigation + screen reader + contrast ratio verified)
All environment variables required by the feature are documented in the .env.example file
Appendix â€” Quick Reference
A. Complete Credit Cost Reference
